message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY. 

This paper focuses on the development of a technique for automatically generating program transformations by leveraging programming-by-example methodology. This methodology involves using examples of code edits performed by developers and instructors to learn transformations that can be applied to similar code. This topic falls under the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SE) as it deals with the automation of common transformations in IDEs and intelligent tutoring systems. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of a domain-specific language (DSL) for describing program transformations, which falls under the sub-category of programming languages (cs.PL). The use of deductive algorithms and ranking functions for synthesizing and evaluating transformations also involves aspects of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the evaluation of the technique on programming tasks and open-source projects involves aspects of cybernetics (cs.CY).
